isDefinedSophisticatedByCMA.label: I am a qualified client as defined by The Capital Market Authority (CMA)
isDefinedSophisticatedByCMA.popover: <0>Qualified Clients as defined by The Capital Market Authority (CMA) of Saudi Arabia are as follows.<1></1><1></1><2>Read more</2></0>

modal.title: The Capital Market Authority (CMA) Qualified Clients
modal.description: <0>According to the Authorized Persons Regulations of the Capital Market Authority (CMA), a qualified client is a person who meets one of the following criteria:</0><3></3><1><2>Has carried out at least 10 transactions per quarter over the last 12 months for a minimum total amount of SR40 million on the securities markets.</2><2>Has net assets no less than SR5 million.</2><2>Works or worked for at least three years in the financial sector in a position related to investment in securities.</2><2>Accredited by an internationally recognized entity.</2><2>Holds the General Securities Qualification Certificate that is recognized by the CMA.</2><2>Is a client of a Capital Market Institution authorized by the CMA.</2></1>

isAccreditedByCBB.label: I am an accredited investor as defined by the Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB)
isAccreditedByCBB.popover: <0>Accredited investors are defined by the Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB) as investors meeting the following criteria.<1></1><1></1><2>Read description</2></0>

modal.title: Investors accredited from the Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB)
modal.description: <0>The Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB) defines accredited investors as investors meeting the following criteria:</0><1><2>Individuals having a minimum net worth (either singly or jointly with their spouse) of USD 1,000,000, excluding the individual’s principal place of residence;</2><2>Companies, partnerships, trusts or other commercial undertakings which have financial assets available for investment of not less than USD 1,000,000; or</2><2>Governments, supranational organizations, central banks or other national monetary authorities and state organizations whose main activity is to invest in financial instruments (such as state pension funds).</2><3></3></1>

Ethical.title: Ethical Investments
Ethical.description: Ethical investing is the practice of selecting investments based on ethical or moral principles. Some beliefs are rooted in environmental, religious, or political precepts. Some investors may choose to eliminate specific industries or over-allocate to other sectors that meet the individual's ethical guidelines.

conservative.title: Conservative
conservative.description: You are a conservative investor. You are looking to truly preserve your wealth while earning modest returns. You do not like the idea of a market downturn and will prepare ahead of time to minimize losses during such events. You wish to achieve consistent returns even if it means giving up some upside.

moderately_conservative.title: Moderately Conservative
moderately_conservative.description: You are a balanced investor who leans towards slightly below average risk. You seek good returns while ensuring a minimum level of consistent returns. You do not panic in a market downturn, but you are cautious. You try to balance between risk and reward without either excessive risk or minimal returns.

moderately_aggressive.title: Moderately Aggressive
moderately_aggressive.description: You are a balanced investor who leans towards slightly above average risk. You seek above average returns while limiting potential downside. You do not panic in a market downturn. You try to balance between risk and reward, but prefer higher returns even if it means slightly higher risk.

aggressive.title: Aggressive
aggressive.description: You are an aggressive investor. You have exceptional tolerance for market fluctuations. You are willing to accept losses for a chance to earn higher returns. You seek higher returns even if it means sacrificing consistent returns in the short term. You muster your emotions in a market downturn and stick to your investment plan.

very_aggressive.title: Very Aggressive
very_aggressive.description: You are an very aggressive investor. You have exceptional tolerance for market fluctuations. You are willing to accept losses for a chance to earn higher returns. You seek higher returns even if it means sacrificing consistent returns in the short term. You muster your emotions in a market downturn and stick to your investment plan.
